title: Body text of emails lost and also no forwarding possible of all emails in local folder based on a NAS
content:
Hi there I tried many solutions that I found concerning body text not displayed. But hat no success. Let me describe in detail. From one day to the other the following happened. 1. Emails in the local folder stored on a NAS (for archive purposes) did no longer display the body text (from one day to the next) However I could still transfer them into the corresponding inbox and then read them. 2. Upon trying to change settings, reinstalling the newest version of Thunderbird and also an older version, the solution of putting the emails into the inbox and reading them or forwarding them to another account does no longer work What I tried: 

      1. Repair the Folder:       2. Rebuild the Global Database:       3. Check for Add-on Conflicts:       4. Verify Account Settings:       5. Examine Local Folders Storage:

Now my knowledge is depleted and I am looking for help. Thanks in advance. nelexc
creator: nelexc

title: How to include only specific folders in Unified folders
content:
Is there a way to hide all folders from Unified Folders except for the Inboxes? I have both, Unified Folders and All Folders visible in the sidebar. For drafts, sent, junk, trash, templates, etc. I prefer to use the respective folders under each email account shown All Folders. But I very much like the Unified Inbox. What I would like to achieve (see the little mock-up image I made):

  • A Unified Inbox (expandable to show individual inboxes, as it is now).
  • Then directly under that, I want the All Folders section to show.

From reading up on the Unified Folders I understand that they are just Saved Searches. So I thought of creating a new custom Saved Search and include all the Inboxes. But unfortunately that seems only possible as subfolders of specific accounts. So I tried and created a Saved Search with all inboxes and IMAP search on under Local Folders. But I can't move it to the top of the list. And it also is not expandable to show individual inboxes as under Unified Folders. Any ideas if something like on the image below is possible to achieve?
creator: jdhauck

title: Trouble moving Thunderbird profile to new hard drive
content:
Having trouble moving TB profile to new hard drive. HP Envy 360, Linux Mint 21.3 SSD crashed, but had a backup of the TB profile, not sure of the version of TB because of the crash. (and therefore can’t Export the files) Updated the computer with an M.2 stick and reinstalled Mint. Fine so far Installed TB, (which is 115.18), and have tried to copy and paste the old profile. Got the following message:

"A newer version of Thunderbird may have made changes to your profile which are no longer compatible with this older version..."

Have tried to import from the saved backup file, and got a red error message. Have tried to replace the Mail file of the new s2p4q…….. default with the Mail file of the backup. Have tried to Can’t figure out why clicking on the 93apdn…… default file only yields “times.json” (see attached pictures) Can’t figure out why in the new profile the 93apdn.. file isn’t the default, and not the s2p4q…

I feel the problem may be that I don’t understand why the 93apdn..default has (only) times.json, and that the .ini file lists it as the default.

It seemed so easy before, I never had to use Export/Import, it was so much easier to just replace the profile. I know it’s a known issue because others have mentioned it since an update of TB.

Any help welcome, thanks
creator: hjtate
